   19: %%
   20: -module(beam_ssa_no_copt_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0,suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1,end_per_suite/1,
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24:          calls/1,tuple_matching/1,recv/1,maps/1,
   25:          cover_ssa_dead/1,combine_sw/1,share_opt/1,
   26:          beam_ssa_dead_crash/1,stack_init/1,
   27:          mapfoldl/0,mapfoldl/1,
   28:          grab_bag/1,redundant_br/1,
   29:          coverage/1,normalize/1,
   30:          trycatch/1,gh_6599/1]).
   31: 
   32: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   33: 
   34: all() ->
   35:     [mapfoldl,
   36:      {group,p}].
   37: 
   38: groups() ->
   39:     [{p,test_lib:parallel(),
   40:       [tuple_matching,
   41:        calls,
   42:        recv,
   43:        maps,
   44:        cover_ssa_dead,
   45:        combine_sw,
   46:        share_opt,
   47:        beam_ssa_dead_crash,
   48:        stack_init,
   49:        grab_bag,
   50:        redundant_br,
   51:        coverage,
   52:        normalize,
   53:        trycatch,
   54:        gh_6599
   55:       ]}].
   56: 
   57: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   58:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   59:     Config.
   60: 
   61: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   62:     ok.
   63: 
   64: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   65:     Config.
   66: 
   67: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   68:     Config.
   69: 
   70: calls(Config) ->
   71:     Ret = {return,value,Config},
   72:     Ret = fun_call(fun(42) -> ok end, Ret),
   73:     Ret = apply_fun(fun(a, b) -> ok end, [a,b], Ret),
   74:     Ret = apply_mfa(test_lib, id, [anything], Ret),
   75:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch call_error()),
   76:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch call_error(42)),
   77:     5 = start_it([erlang,length,1,2,3,4,5]),
   78: 
   79:     {_,ok} = cover_call(id(true)),
   80:     {_,ok} = cover_call(id(false)),
   81:     {'EXIT',{{case_clause,ok},_}} = catch cover_call(id(ok)),
   82: 
   83:     ok.
   84: 
   85: fun_call(Fun, X0) ->
   86:     X = id(X0),
   87:     Fun(42),
   88:     X.
   89: 
   90: apply_fun(Fun, Args, X0) ->
   91:     X = id(X0),
   92:     apply(Fun, Args),
   93:     X.
   94: 
   95: apply_mfa(Mod, Name, Args, X0) ->
   96:     X = id(X0),
   97:     apply(Mod, Name, Args),
   98:     X.
   99: 
  100: call_error() ->
  101:     error(badarg),
  102:     ok.
  103: 
  104: call_error(I) ->
  105:     <<I:(-8)>>,
  106:     ok.
  107: 
  108: start_it([_|_]=MFA) ->
  109:     case MFA of
  110: 	[M,F|Args] -> M:F(Args)
  111:     end.
  112: 
  113: cover_call(A) ->
  114:     case A =/= ok of
  115:         B ->
  116:             {(term_to_binary(ok)),
  117:              case ok of
  118:                  _  when B -> ok
  119:              end}
  120:     end.
  121: 
  122: 
  123: tuple_matching(_Config) ->
  124:     do_tuple_matching({tag,42}),
  125: 
  126:     true = is_two_tuple({a,b}),
  127:     false = is_two_tuple({a,b,c}),
  128:     false = is_two_tuple(atom),
  129: 
  130:     ok.
  131: 
  132: do_tuple_matching(Arg) ->
  133:     Res = do_tuple_matching_1(Arg),
  134:     Res = do_tuple_matching_2(Arg),
  135:     Res = do_tuple_matching_3(Arg),
  136:     Res.
  137: 
  138: do_tuple_matching_1({tag,V}) ->
  139:     {ok,V}.
  140: 
  141: do_tuple_matching_2(Tuple) when is_tuple(Tuple) ->
  142:     Size = tuple_size(Tuple),
  143:     if
  144:         Size =:= 2 ->
  145:             {ok,element(2, Tuple)}
  146:     end.
  147: 
  148: do_tuple_matching_3(Tuple) when is_tuple(Tuple) ->
  149:     Size = tuple_size(Tuple),
  150:     if
  151:         Size =:= 2 ->
  152:             2 = id(Size),
  153:             {ok,element(2, Tuple)}
  154:     end.
  155: 
  156: is_two_tuple(Arg) ->
  157:     case is_tuple(Arg) of
  158:         false -> false;
  159:         true -> tuple_size(Arg) == 2
  160:     end.
  161: 
  162: -record(reporter_state, {res,run_config}).
  163: -record(run_config, {report_interval=0}).
  164: 
  165: recv(_Config) ->
  166:     Parent = self(),
  167: 
  168:     %% Test sync_wait_mon/2.
  169:     Succ = fun() -> Parent ! {ack,self(),{result,42}} end,
  170:     {result,42} = sync_wait_mon(spawn_monitor(Succ), infinity),
  171: 
  172:     Down = fun() -> exit(down) end,
  173:     {error,down} = sync_wait_mon(spawn_monitor(Down), infinity),
  174: 
  175:     Exit = fun() ->
  176:                    Self = self(),
  177:                    spawn(fun() -> exit(Self, kill_me) end),
  178:                    receive _ -> ok end
  179:            end,
  180:     {error,kill_me} = sync_wait_mon(spawn_monitor(Exit), infinity),
  181: 
  182:     Timeout = fun() -> receive _ -> ok end end,
  183:     {error,timeout} = sync_wait_mon(spawn_monitor(Timeout), 0),
  184: 
  185:     %% Test reporter_loop/1.
  186:     {a,Parent} = reporter_loop(#reporter_state{res={a,Parent},
  187:                                                run_config=#run_config{}}),
  188: 
  189:     %% Test bad_sink/0.
  190:     bad_sink(),
  191: 
  192:     %% Test tricky_recv_1/0.
  193:     self() ! 1,
  194:     a = tricky_recv_1(),
  195:     self() ! 2,
  196:     b = tricky_recv_1(),
  197: 
  198:     %% Test tricky_recv_2/0.
  199:     self() ! 1,
  200:     {1,yes} = tricky_recv_2(),
  201:     self() ! 2,
  202:     {2,'maybe'} = tricky_recv_2(),
  203: 
  204:     %% Test 'receive after infinity' in try/catch.
  205:     Pid = spawn(fun recv_after_inf_in_try/0),
  206:     exit(Pid, done),
  207: 
  208:     %% Test tricky_recv_3().
  209:     self() ! {{self(),r0},{1,42,"name"}},
  210:     {Parent,r0,[<<1:32,1:8,42:8>>,"name",0]} = tricky_recv_3(),
  211:     self() ! {{self(),r1},{2,99,<<"data">>}},
  212:     {Parent,r1,<<1:32,2:8,99:8,"data">>} = tricky_recv_3(),
  213: 
  214:     %% Test tricky_recv_4().
  215:     self() ! {[self(),r0],{1,42,"name"}},
  216:     {Parent,r0,[<<1:32,1:8,42:8>>,"name",0]} = tricky_recv_4(),
  217:     self() ! {[self(),r1],{2,99,<<"data">>}},
  218:     {Parent,r1,<<1:32,2:8,99:8,"data">>} = tricky_recv_4(),
  219: 
  220:     %% Test tricky_recv_5/0.
  221:     self() ! 1,
  222:     a = tricky_recv_5(),
  223:     self() ! 2,
  224:     b = tricky_recv_5(),
  225: 
  226:     %% Test tricky_recv_5a/0.
  227:     self() ! 1,
  228:     a = tricky_recv_5a(),
  229:     self() ! 2,
  230:     b = tricky_recv_5a(),
  231:     self() ! any,
  232:     b = tricky_recv_5a(),
  233: 
  234:     %% tricky_recv_6/0 is a compile-time error.
  235:     tricky_recv_6(),
  236: 
  237:     recv_coverage(),
  238: 
  239:     ok.
  240: 
  241: sync_wait_mon({Pid, Ref}, Timeout) ->
  242:     receive
  243: 	{ack,Pid,Return} ->
  244: 	    erlang:demonitor(Ref, [flush]),
  245: 	    Return;
  246: 	{'DOWN',Ref,_Type,Pid,Reason} ->
  247: 	    {error,Reason};
  248: 	{'EXIT',Pid,Reason} ->
  249: 	    erlang:demonitor(Ref, [flush]),
  250: 	    {error,Reason}
  251:     after Timeout ->
  252:             erlang:demonitor(Ref, [flush]),
  253:             exit(Pid, kill),
  254:             {error,timeout}
  255:     end.
  256: 
  257: reporter_loop(State) ->
  258:     RC = State#reporter_state.run_config,
  259:     receive after RC#run_config.report_interval ->
  260:                     State#reporter_state.res
  261:     end.
  262: 
  263: bad_sink() ->
  264:     {ok,Pid} = my_spawn(self()),
  265:     %% The get_tuple_element instruction for the matching
  266:     %% above was sinked into the receive loop. That will
  267:     %% not work (and would be bad for performance if it
  268:     %% would work).
  269:     receive
  270:         {ok,Pid} ->
  271:             ok;
  272:         error ->
  273:             exit(failed)
  274:     end,
  275:     exit(Pid, kill).
  276: 
  277: my_spawn(Parent) ->
  278:     Pid = spawn(fun() ->
  279:                         Parent ! {ok,self()},
  280:                         receive _ -> ok end
  281:                 end),
  282:     {ok,Pid}.
  283: 
  284: tricky_recv_1() ->
  285:     receive
  286:         X=1 ->
  287:             id(42),
  288:             a;
  289:         X=2 ->
  290:             b
  291:     end,
  292:     case X of
  293:         1 -> a;
  294:         2 -> b
  295:     end.
  296: 
  297: tricky_recv_2() ->
  298:     receive
  299:         X=1 ->
  300:             Y = case id(X) of
  301:                     1 -> yes;
  302:                     _ -> no
  303:                 end,
  304:             a;
  305:         X=2 ->
  306:             Y = 'maybe',
  307:             b
  308:     end,
  309:     {X,Y}.
  310: 
  311: recv_after_inf_in_try() ->
  312:     try
  313:         %% Used to crash beam_kernel_to_ssa.
  314:         receive after infinity -> ok end
  315:     catch
  316: 	_A:_B ->
  317: 	    receive after infinity -> ok end
  318:     end.
  319: 
  320: tricky_recv_3() ->
  321:     {Pid, R, Request} =
  322: 	receive
  323: 	    {{Pid0,R0}, {1, Proto0, Name0}} ->
  324: 		{Pid0, R0,
  325: 		 [<<1:32, 1:8, Proto0:8>>,Name0,0]};
  326: 	    {{Pid1,R1}, {2, Proto1, Data1}}  ->
  327: 		{Pid1, R1,
  328: 		 <<1:32, 2:8, Proto1:8, Data1/binary>>}
  329: 	end,
  330:     id({Pid,R,Request}).
  331: 
  332: tricky_recv_4() ->
  333:     {Pid, R, Request} =
  334: 	receive
  335: 	    {[Pid0,R0], {1, Proto0, Name0}} ->
  336: 		{Pid0, R0,
  337: 		 [<<1:32, 1:8, Proto0:8>>,Name0,0]};
  338: 	    {[Pid1,R1], {2, Proto1, Data1}}  ->
  339: 		{Pid1, R1,
  340: 		 <<1:32, 2:8, Proto1:8, Data1/binary>>}
  341: 	end,
  342:     id({Pid,R,Request}).
  343: 
  344: %% beam_ssa_pre_codegen would accidentally create phi nodes on critical edges
  345: %% when fixing up receives; the call to id/2 can either succeed or land in the
  346: %% catch block, and we added a phi node to its immediate successor.
  347: tricky_recv_5() ->
  348:     try
  349:         receive
  350:             X=1 ->
  351:                 id(42),
  352:                 a;
  353:             X=2 ->
  354:                 b
  355:         end,
  356:         case X of
  357:             1 -> a;
  358:             2 -> b
  359:         end
  360:     catch
  361:         _:_ -> c
  362:     end.
  363: 
  364: %% beam_ssa_pre_codegen would find the wrong exit block when fixing up
  365: %% receives.
  366: tricky_recv_5a() ->
  367:     try
  368:         receive
  369:             X=1 ->
  370:                 id(42),
  371:                 a;
  372:             X=_ ->
  373:                 b
  374:         end,
  375:         %% The following is the code in the common exit block.
  376:         if X =:= 1 -> a;
  377:            true -> b
  378:         end
  379:     catch
  380:         %% But this code with the landingpad instruction was found,
  381:         %% because it happened to occur before the true exit block
  382:         %% in the reverse post order.
  383:         _:_ -> c
  384:     end.
  385: 
  386: 
  387: %% When fixing tricky_recv_5, we introduced a compiler crash when the common
  388: %% exit block was ?EXCEPTION_BLOCK and floats were in the picture.
  389: tricky_recv_6() ->
  390:     RefA = make_ref(),
  391:     RefB = make_ref(),
  392:     receive
  393:         {RefA, Number} -> Number + 1.0;
  394:         {RefB, Number} -> Number + 2.0
  395:     after 0 ->
  396:         ok
  397:     end.
  398: 
  399: recv_coverage() ->
  400:     self() ! 1,
  401:     a = recv_coverage_1(),
  402:     self() ! 2,
  403:     b = recv_coverage_1(),
  404: 
  405:     self() ! 1,
  406:     a = recv_coverage_2(),
  407:     self() ! 2,
  408:     b = recv_coverage_2(),
  409: 
  410:     ok.
  411: 
  412: %% Similar to tricky_recv_5/0, but provides test coverage for the #b_switch{}
  413: %% terminator.
  414: recv_coverage_1() ->
  415:     receive
  416:         X=1 ->
  417:             %% Jump to common exit block through #b_switch{list=L}
  418:             case id(0) of
  419:                 0 -> a;
  420:                 1 -> b;
  421:                 2 -> c;
  422:                 3 -> d
  423:             end;
  424:         X=2 ->
  425:             %% Jump to common exit block through #b_switch{fail=F}
  426:             case id(42) of
  427:                 0 -> exit(quit);
  428:                 1 -> exit(quit);
  429:                 2 -> exit(quit);
  430:                 3 -> exit(quit);
  431:                 _ -> b
  432:             end
  433:     end,
  434:     case X of
  435:         1 -> a;
  436:         2 -> b
  437:     end.
  438: 
  439: %% Similar to recv_coverage_1/0, providing test coverage for #b_br{}.
  440: recv_coverage_2() ->
  441:     receive
  442:         X=1 ->
  443:             A = id(1),
  444:             %% Jump to common exit block through #b_br{succ=S}.
  445:             if
  446:                 A =:= 1 -> a;
  447:                 true -> exit(quit)
  448:             end;
  449:         X=2 ->
  450:             A = id(2),
  451:             %% Jump to common exit block through #b_br{fail=F}.
  452:             if
  453:                 A =:= 1 -> exit(quit);
  454:                 true -> a
  455:             end
  456:     end,
  457:     case X of
  458:         1 -> a;
  459:         2 -> b
  460:     end.
  461: 
  462: maps(_Config) ->
  463:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,#{}},_}} = (catch maps_1(any)),
  464: 
  465:     {jkl,nil,nil} = maps_2(#{abc => 0, jkl => 0}),
  466:     {def,ghi,abc} = maps_2(#{abc => 0, def => 0}),
  467:     {def,ghi,jkl} = maps_2(#{def => 0, jkl => 0}),
  468:     {mno,nil,abc} = maps_2(#{abc => 0, mno => 0, jkl => 0}),
  469:     {jkl,nil,nil} = maps_2(#{jkl => 0}),
  470:     error = maps_2(#{}),
  471: 
  472:     [] = maps_3(),
  473: 
  474:     {'EXIT',{{badmap,true},_}} = catch maps_4(id(true), id(true)),
  475:     error = maps_4(id(#{}), id(true)),
  476:     error = maps_4(id(#{}), id(#{})),
  477: 
  478:     ok.
  479: 
  480: maps_1(K) ->
  481:     _ = id(42),
  482:     #{K:=V} = #{},
  483:     V.
  484: 
  485: maps_2(Map) ->
  486:     Res = maps_2a(Map),
  487:     Res = maps_2b(Map),
  488:     Res.
  489: 
  490: maps_2a(#{} = Map) ->
  491:     case case Abc = is_map_key(abc, Map) of
  492:              false -> false;
  493:              _ -> is_map_key(def, Map)
  494:          end of
  495:         true ->
  496:             {def, ghi, abc};
  497:         false ->
  498:             case case Jkl = is_map_key(jkl, Map) of
  499:                      false -> false;
  500:                      _ -> is_map_key(def, Map)
  501:                  end of
  502:                 true ->
  503:                     {def, ghi, jkl};
  504:                 false ->
  505:                     case case Abc of
  506:                              false -> false;
  507:                              _ -> is_map_key(mno, Map)
  508:                          end of
  509:                         true ->
  510:                             {mno, nil, abc};
  511:                         false ->
  512:                             case Jkl of
  513:                                 true -> {jkl, nil, nil};
  514:                                 false -> error
  515:                             end
  516:                     end
  517:             end
  518:     end.
  519: 
  520: maps_2b(#{}=Map) ->
  521:     case case is_map_key(abc, Map) of
  522:              false -> false;
  523:              _ -> is_map_key(def, Map)
  524:          end of
  525:         true ->
  526:             {def, ghi, abc};
  527:         false ->
  528:             case case is_map_key(jkl, Map) of
  529:                      false -> false;
  530:                      _ -> is_map_key(def, Map)
  531:                  end of
  532:                 true ->
  533:                     {def, ghi, jkl};
  534:                 false ->
  535:                     case case is_map_key(abc, Map) of
  536:                              false -> false;
  537:                              _ -> is_map_key(mno, Map)
  538:                          end of
  539:                         true ->
  540:                             {mno, nil, abc};
  541:                         false ->
  542:                             case is_map_key(jkl, Map) of
  543:                                 true -> {jkl, nil, nil};
  544:                                 false -> error
  545:                             end
  546:                     end
  547:             end
  548:     end.
  549: 
  550: %% Cover code in beam_ssa_codegen.
  551: maps_3() ->
  552:     [] = case #{} of
  553:              #{ok := {}} ->
  554:                  ok;
  555:              _ ->
  556:                  []
  557:          end -- [].
  558: 
  559: maps_4(A, B = A) when B; A ->
  560:     A#{ok := ok},
  561:     try A of
  562:         B -> B
  563:     after
  564:         ok
  565:     end#{ok := ok};
  566: maps_4(_, _) ->
  567:     error.
  568: 
  569: -record(wx_ref, {type=any_type,ref=any_ref}).
  570: 
  571: cover_ssa_dead(_Config) ->
  572:     str = format_str(str, escapable, [], true),
  573:     [iolist,str] = format_str(str, escapable, iolist, true),
  574:     bad = format_str(str, not_escapable, [], true),
  575:     bad = format_str(str, not_escapable, iolist, true),
  576:     bad = format_str(str, escapable, [], false),
  577:     bad = format_str(str, escapable, [], bad),
  578: 
  579:     DefWxRef = #wx_ref{},
  580:     {DefWxRef,77,9999,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, 77, 9999),
  581:     {DefWxRef,77.0,9999,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, 77.0, 9999),
  582:     {DefWxRef,77,9999.0,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, 77, 9999.0),
  583:     {DefWxRef,77.0,9999.0,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, 77.0, 9999.0),
  584:     {any_type,any_ref,42,43,[option]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, {42,43}, [option]),
  585:     {any_type,any_ref,42,43,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, {42,43}, []),
  586:     {any_type,any_ref,42.0,43,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, {42.0,43}, []),
  587:     {any_type,any_ref,42,43.0,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, {42,43.0}, []),
  588:     {any_type,any_ref,42.0,43.0,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, {42.0,43.0}, []),
  589: 
  590:     nope = conv_alub(false, '=:='),
  591:     ok = conv_alub(true, '=:='),
  592:     ok = conv_alub(true, none),
  593:     error = conv_alub(false, none),
  594: 
  595:     {false,false} = eval_alu(false, false, false),
  596:     {true,false}  = eval_alu(false, false, true),
  597:     {false,true}  = eval_alu(false, true, false),
  598:     {false,false} = eval_alu(false, true, true),
  599:     {false,true}  = eval_alu(true, false, false),
  600:     {false,false} = eval_alu(true, false, true),
  601:     {true,true}   = eval_alu(true, true, false),
  602:     {false,true}  = eval_alu(true, true, true),
  603: 
  604:     100.0 = percentage(1.0, 0.0),
  605:     100.0 = percentage(1, 0),
  606:     0.0 = percentage(0, 0),
  607:     0.0 = percentage(0.0, 0.0),
  608:     40.0 = percentage(4.0, 10.0),
  609:     60.0 = percentage(6, 10),
  610: 
  611:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,42},_}} = (catch #{key => abs(("a" = id(42)) /= teacher)}),
  612: 
  613:     <<>> = id(<< V || V <- [], V andalso false >>),
  614: 
  615:     false = id(([] = id([])) =/= []),
  616: 
  617:     ok.
  618: 
  619: format_str(Str, FormatData, IoList, EscChars) ->
  620:     Escapable = FormatData =:= escapable,
  621:     case id(Str) of
  622:         IoStr when Escapable, EscChars, IoList == [] ->
  623:             id(IoStr);
  624:         IoStr when Escapable, EscChars ->
  625:             [IoList,id(IoStr)];
  626:         _ ->
  627:             bad
  628:     end.
  629: 
  630: contains(This, X, Y) when is_record(This, wx_ref), is_number(X), is_number(Y) ->
  631:     {This,X,Y,[]};
  632: contains(#wx_ref{type=ThisT,ref=ThisRef}, {CX,CY}, Options)
  633:   when is_number(CX), is_number(CY), is_list(Options) ->
  634:     {ThisT,ThisRef,CX,CY,Options}.
  635: 
  636: conv_alub(HasDst, CmpOp) ->
  637:     case (not HasDst) andalso CmpOp =/= none of
  638:         true -> nope;
  639:         false ->
  640:             case HasDst of
  641:                 false -> error;
  642:                 true -> ok
  643:             end
  644:     end.
  645: 
  646: eval_alu(Sign1, Sign2, N) ->
  647:     V = (Sign1 andalso Sign2 andalso (not N))
  648:         or ((not Sign1) andalso (not Sign2) andalso N),
  649:     C = (Sign1 andalso Sign2)
  650:           or ((not N) andalso (Sign1 orelse Sign2)),
  651:     {V,C}.
  652: 
  653: percentage(Divident, Divisor) ->
  654:     if Divisor == 0 andalso Divident /= 0 ->
  655:             100.0;
  656:        Divisor == 0 ->
  657:             0.0;
  658:        true ->
  659:             Divident / Divisor * 100
  660:     end.
  661: 
  662: combine_sw(_Config) ->
  663:     [a] = do_comb_sw_1(a),
  664:     [b,b] = do_comb_sw_1(b),
  665:     [c] = do_comb_sw_1(c),
  666:     [c] = do_comb_sw_1(c),
  667:     [] = do_comb_sw_1(z),
  668: 
  669:     [a] = do_comb_sw_2(a),
  670:     [b2,b1] = do_comb_sw_2(b),
  671:     [c] = do_comb_sw_2(c),
  672:     [c] = do_comb_sw_2(c),
  673:     [] = do_comb_sw_2(z),
  674: 
  675:     ok.
  676: 
  677: do_comb_sw_1(X) ->
  678:     put(?MODULE, []),
  679:     if
  680:         X == a; X == b ->
  681:             put(?MODULE, [X|get(?MODULE)]);
  682:         true ->
  683:             ok
  684:     end,
  685:     if
  686:         X == b; X == c ->
  687:             put(?MODULE, [X|get(?MODULE)]);
  688:         true ->
  689:             ok
  690:     end,
  691:     erase(?MODULE).
  692: 
  693: do_comb_sw_2(X) ->
  694:     put(?MODULE, []),
  695:     case X of
  696:         a ->
  697:             put(?MODULE, [a|get(?MODULE)]);
  698:         b ->
  699:             put(?MODULE, [b1|get(?MODULE)]);
  700:         _ ->
  701:             ok
  702:     end,
  703:     case X of
  704:         b ->
  705:             put(?MODULE, [b2|get(?MODULE)]);
  706:         c ->
  707:             put(?MODULE, [c|get(?MODULE)]);
  708:         _ ->
  709:             ok
  710:     end,
  711:     erase(?MODULE).
  712: 
  713: share_opt(_Config) ->
  714:     ok = do_share_opt_1(0),
  715:     ok = do_share_opt_2(),
  716:     ok = do_share_opt_3(),
  717:     ok.
  718: 
  719: do_share_opt_1(A) ->
  720:     %% The compiler would be stuck in an infinite loop in beam_ssa_share.
  721:     case A of
  722:         0 -> a;
  723:         1 -> b;
  724:         2 -> c
  725:     end,
  726:     receive after 1 -> ok end.
  727: 
  728: do_share_opt_2() ->
  729:     ok = sopt_2({[pointtopoint], [{dstaddr,any}]}, ok),
  730:     ok = sopt_2({[broadcast], [{broadaddr,any}]}, ok),
  731:     ok = sopt_2({[], []}, ok),
  732:     ok.
  733: 
  734: sopt_2({Flags, Opts}, ok) ->
  735:     Broadcast = lists:member(broadcast, Flags),
  736:     P2P = lists:member(pointtopoint, Flags),
  737:     case Opts of
  738:         %% The following two clauses would be combined to one, silently
  739:         %% discarding the guard test of the P2P variable.
  740:         [{broadaddr,_}|Os] when Broadcast ->
  741:             sopt_2({Flags, Os}, ok);
  742:         [{dstaddr,_}|Os] when P2P ->
  743:             sopt_2({Flags, Os}, ok);
  744:         [] ->
  745:             ok
  746:     end.
  747: 
  748: do_share_opt_3() ->
  749:     true = sopt_3(id(ok)),
  750:     false = sopt_3(id(nok)),
  751:     ok.
  752: 
  753: sopt_3(X) ->
  754:     %% Must be one line to trigger bug.
  755:     case X of ok -> id(?LINE), true; _ -> id(?LINE), false end.
  756: 
  757: beam_ssa_dead_crash(_Config) ->
  758:     not_A_B = do_beam_ssa_dead_crash(id(false), id(true)),
  759:     not_A_not_B = do_beam_ssa_dead_crash(false, false),
  760:     neither = do_beam_ssa_dead_crash(true, false),
  761:     neither = do_beam_ssa_dead_crash(true, true),
  762:     ok.
  763: 
  764: do_beam_ssa_dead_crash(A, B) ->
  765:     %% beam_ssa_dead attempts to shortcut branches that branch other
  766:     %% branches. When a two-way branch is encountered, beam_ssa_dead
  767:     %% will simulate execution along both paths, in the hope that both
  768:     %% paths happens to end up in the same place.
  769:     %%
  770:     %% During the simulated execution of this function, the boolean
  771:     %% variable for a `br` instruction would be replaced with the
  772:     %% literal atom `nil`, which is not allowed, and would crash the
  773:     %% compiler. In practice, during the actual execution, control
  774:     %% would never be transferred to that `br` instruction when the
  775:     %% variable in question had the value `nil`.
  776:     %%
  777:     %% beam_ssa_dead has been updated to immediately abort the search
  778:     %% along the current path if there is an attempt to substitute a
  779:     %% non-boolean value into a `br` instruction.
  780: 
  781:     case
  782:         case not A of
  783:             false ->
  784:                 false;
  785:             true ->
  786:                 B
  787:         end
  788:     of
  789:         V
  790:             when
  791:                 V /= nil
  792:                 andalso
  793:                 V /= false ->
  794:             not_A_B;
  795:         _ ->
  796:             case
  797:                 case not A of
  798:                     false ->
  799:                         false;
  800:                     true ->
  801:                         not B
  802:                 end
  803:             of
  804:                 true ->
  805:                     not_A_not_B;
  806:                 false ->
  807:                     neither
  808:             end
  809:     end.
  810: 
  811: stack_init(_Config) ->
  812:     6 = stack_init(a, #{a => [1,2,3]}),
  813:     0 = stack_init(missing, #{}),
  814:     ok.
  815: 
  816: stack_init(Key, Map) ->
  817:     %% beam_ssa_codegen would wrongly assume that y(0) would always be
  818:     %% initialized by the `get_map_elements` instruction that follows, and
  819:     %% would set up the stack frame using an `allocate` instruction and
  820:     %% would not generate an `init` instruction to initialize y(0).
  821:     Res = case Map of
  822:               #{Key := Elements} ->
  823:                   %% Elements will be assigned to y(0) if the key Key exists.
  824:                   lists:foldl(fun(El, Acc) ->
  825:                                       Acc + El
  826:                               end, 0, Elements);
  827:               #{} ->
  828:                   %% y(0) will be left uninitialized when the key is not
  829:                   %% present in the map.
  830:                   0
  831:           end,
  832:     %% y(0) would be uninitialized here if the key was not present in the map
  833:     %% (if the second clause was executed).
  834:     id(Res).
  835: 
  836: %% Test that compiler "optimizations" don't rewrite mapfold/3 to the
  837: %% equivalent of slow_mapfoldl/3.
  838: mapfoldl() ->
  839:     {N,Size} = mapfoldl_limits(),
  840:     {Time,_} = timer:tc(fun() ->
  841:                                 mapfoldl(fun(Sz, _) ->
  842:                                                  erlang:garbage_collect(),
  843:                                                  {Sz,erlang:make_tuple(Sz, a)}
  844:                                          end, [], [Size])
  845:                         end),
  846:     Seconds = 15 + ceil(10 * Time * N / 1_000_000),
  847:     io:format("~p seconds timetrap\n", [Seconds]),
  848:     [{timetrap,{seconds,Seconds}}].
  849: 
  850: mapfoldl(_Config) ->
  851:     test_mapfoldl_implementations(),
  852:     F = fun(Sz, _) ->
  853:                 erlang:garbage_collect(),
  854:                 {Sz,erlang:make_tuple(Sz, a)}
  855:         end,
  856:     {N,Size} = mapfoldl_limits(),
  857:     List = lists:duplicate(N, Size),
  858:     {List,Tuple} = mapfoldl(F, [], List),
  859:     {List,Tuple} = fast_mapfoldl(F, [], List),
  860:     Size = tuple_size(Tuple),
  861:     ok.
  862: 
  863: mapfoldl_limits() ->
  864:     {1_000,100_000}.
  865: 
  866: test_mapfoldl_implementations() ->
  867:     Seq = lists:seq(1, 10),
  868:     F = fun(N, Sum) -> {N,Sum+N} end,
  869:     {Seq,55} = mapfoldl(F, 0, Seq),
  870:     {Seq,55} = fast_mapfoldl(F, 0, Seq),
  871:     {Seq,55} = slow_mapfoldl(F, 0, Seq),
  872:     ok.
  873: 
  874: mapfoldl(F, Acc0, [Hd|Tail]) ->
  875:     {R,Acc1} = F(Hd, Acc0),
  876:     {Rs,Acc2} = mapfoldl(F, Acc1, Tail),
  877:     {[R|Rs],Acc2};
  878: mapfoldl(F, Acc, []) when is_function(F, 2) -> {[],Acc}.
  879: 
  880: %% Here is an illustration of how the compiler used to sink
  881: %% get_tuple_element instructions in a way that would cause all
  882: %% versions of the accumulator to be kept until the end. The compiler
  883: %% now uses a heuristic to only sink get_tuple_element instructions if
  884: %% that would cause fewer values to be saved in the stack frame.
  885: slow_mapfoldl(F, Acc0, [Hd|Tail]) ->
  886:     Res1 = F(Hd, Acc0),
  887:     %% By saving the Res1 tuple, all intermediate accumulators will be
  888:     %% kept to the end.
  889:     Res2 = slow_mapfoldl(F, element(2, Res1), Tail),
  890:     {[element(1, Res1)|element(1, Res2)],element(2, Res2)};
  891: slow_mapfoldl(F, Acc, []) when is_function(F, 2) -> {[],Acc}.
  892: 
  893: %% Here is an illustration how the compiler should compile mapfoldl/3
  894: %% to avoid keeping all intermediate accumulators. Note that
  895: %% slow_mapfoldl/3 and fast_mapfoldl/3 use the same amount of stack
  896: %% space.
  897: fast_mapfoldl(F, Acc0, [Hd|Tail]) ->
  898:     Res1 = F(Hd, Acc0),
  899:     R = element(1, Res1),
  900:     Res2 = fast_mapfoldl(F, element(2, Res1), Tail),
  901:     {[R|element(1, Res2)],element(2, Res2)};
  902: fast_mapfoldl(F, Acc, []) when is_function(F, 2) -> {[],Acc}.
  903: 
  904: grab_bag(_Config) ->
  905:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch grab_bag_1()),
  906:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch grab_bag_2()),
  907:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch grab_bag_3()),
  908:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch grab_bag_4()),
  909:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,[{?MODULE,grab_bag_5,[a,17],_}|_]}} =
  910:         (catch grab_bag_5(a, 17)),
  911:     way = grab_bag_6(face),
  912:     no_match = grab_bag_6("ABC"),
  913:     no_match = grab_bag_6(any),
  914:     ok = grab_bag_7(),
  915:     [] = grab_bag_8(),
  916:     ok = grab_bag_9(),
  917:     whatever = grab_bag_10(ignore, whatever),
  918:     other = grab_bag_11(),
  919:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch grab_bag_12()),
  920:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,[]},_}} = (catch grab_bag_13()),
  921:     timeout = grab_bag_14(),
  922:     ?MODULE = grab_bag_15(?MODULE),
  923: 
  924:     error = grab_bag_16a(timeout_value),
  925:     {'EXIT',{timeout_value,_}} = (catch grab_bag_16a(whatever)),
  926:     {'EXIT',{timeout_value,_}} = (catch grab_bag_16b(whatever)),
  927:     timeout_value = grab_bag_16b(error),
  928: 
  929:     fact = grab_bag_17(),
  930: 
  931:     {'EXIT',{{try_clause,[]},[_|_]}} = catch grab_bag_18(),
  932: 
  933:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,[whatever]},[_|_]}} = catch grab_bag_19(),
  934: 
  935:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,[_|_]}} = catch grab_bag_20(),
  936: 
  937:     6 = grab_bag_21(id(64)),
  938:     {'EXIT',{badarith,_}} = catch grab_bag_21(id(a)),
  939: 
  940:     false = grab_bag_22(),
  941: 
  942:     ok.
  943: 
  944: grab_bag_1() ->
  945:     %% beam_kernel_to_ssa would crash when attempting to translate a make_fun
  946:     %% instruction without a destination variable.
  947:     (catch fun () -> 15 end)(true#{}).
  948: 
  949: grab_bag_2() ->
  950:     %% is_guard_cg_safe/1 will be called with #cg_unreachable{}, which was
  951:     %% not handled.
  952:     27
  953:         or
  954:     try
  955:         try
  956:             x#{}
  957:         catch
  958:             _:_ ->
  959:                 []
  960:         end
  961:     after
  962:         false
  963:     end.
  964: 
  965: grab_bag_3() ->
  966:     case
  967:         fun (V0)
  968:               when
  969:                   %% The only thing left after optimizations would be
  970:                   %% a bs_add instruction not followed by succeeded,
  971:                   %% which would crash beam_ssa_codegen because there
  972:                   %% was no failure label available.
  973:                   binary_part(<<>>,
  974:                               <<V0:V0/unit:196>>) ->
  975:                 []
  976:         end
  977:     of
  978:         <<>> ->
  979:             []
  980:     end.
  981: 
  982: grab_bag_4() ->
  983:     %% beam_kernel_to_ssa would crash because there was a #cg_phi{}
  984:     %% instruction that was not referenced from any #cg_break{}.
  985:     case $f of
  986:         V0 ->
  987:             try
  988:                 try fy of
  989:                     V0 ->
  990:                         fu
  991:                 catch
  992:                     throw:$s ->
  993:                         fy
  994:                 end
  995:             catch
  996:                 error:#{#{[] + [] => []} := false} when [] ->
  997:                     fy
  998:             after
  999:                 ok
 1000:             end
 1001:     end.
 1002: 
 1003: grab_bag_5(_A, _B) when <<business:(node(power))>> ->
 1004:     true.
 1005: 
 1006: grab_bag_6(face) ->
 1007:     way;
 1008: grab_bag_6("ABC") when (node([]))#{size(door) => $k} ->
 1009:     false;
 1010: grab_bag_6(_) ->
 1011:     no_match.
 1012: 
 1013: grab_bag_7() ->
 1014:     catch
 1015:         case
 1016:             case 1.6 of
 1017:                 %% The hd([] call will be translated to erlang:error(badarg).
 1018:                 %% This case exports two variables in Core Erlang (the
 1019:                 %% return value of the case and V). beam_kernel_to_ssa was not
 1020:                 %% prepared to handle a call to error/1 which is supposed to
 1021:                 %% export two variables.
 1022:                 <<0.5:(hd([])),V:false>> ->
 1023:                     ok
 1024:             end
 1025:         of
 1026:             _ ->
 1027:                 V
 1028:         end,
 1029:         ok.
 1030: 
 1031: %% ssa_opt_sink would crash if sys_core_fold had not been run.
 1032: grab_bag_8() ->
 1033:     try
 1034:         []
 1035:     catch
 1036:         _:_ ->
 1037:             try
 1038:                 []
 1039:             catch
 1040:                 _:any:_ ->
 1041:                     a
 1042:             end;
 1043:         _:right ->
 1044:             b
 1045:     end.
 1046: 
 1047: %% The ssa_opt_try optimization would leave a succeeded:body
 1048: %% instruction followed by a #b_ret{} terminator, which would crash
 1049: %% beam_ssa_pre_codegen.
 1050: grab_bag_9() ->
 1051:     catch
 1052:         <<1 || 99, [] <- hour>> bsr false,
 1053:         ok.
 1054: 
 1055: grab_bag_10(_, V) ->
 1056:     %% This function needs a stack frame in order to preserve V.
 1057:     fun() -> ok end,
 1058:     V.
 1059: 
 1060: grab_bag_11() ->
 1061:     try 0 of
 1062:         false -> error;
 1063:         true -> ok;
 1064:         _ -> other
 1065:     catch
 1066:         _:_ ->
 1067:             caught
 1068:     end.
 1069: 
 1070: grab_bag_12() ->
 1071:     %% beam_ssa_pre_codegen would try to place the created map in x1.
 1072:     %% That would not be safe because x0 is not initialized.
 1073:     check_process_code(1, (#{})#{key := teacher}),
 1074:     ok.
 1075: 
 1076: grab_bag_13() ->
 1077:     %% If sys_core_fold was skipped, beam_ssa_beam would leave
 1078:     %% unreachable code with invalid phi nodes.
 1079:     case <<810:true>> = [] of
 1080:         <<709:false>> ->
 1081:             ok;
 1082:         whatever ->
 1083:             case 42 of
 1084:                 175 ->
 1085:                     {ok,case "b" of
 1086:                             $X -> time
 1087:                         end}
 1088:             end
 1089:     end.
 1090: 
 1091: grab_bag_14() ->
 1092:     %% If optimizations were turned off, beam_ssa_pre_codegen would
 1093:     %% sanitize the binary construction instruction, replacing it with
 1094:     %% a call to erlang:error/1, which is not allowed in a receive.
 1095:     receive
 1096:         #{<<42:(-1)>> := _} ->
 1097:             ok
 1098:     after 0 ->
 1099:             timeout
 1100:     end.
 1101: 
 1102: grab_bag_15(V) ->
 1103:     %% Instead of:
 1104:     %%
 1105:     %%    move x0, y0
 1106:     %%    move y0, x0
 1107:     %%
 1108:     %% a swap instruction would be emitted by beam_ssa_codegen:
 1109:     %%
 1110:     %%    swap x0, y0
 1111:     %%
 1112:     case [] of
 1113:         [] -> V
 1114:     end:all(),
 1115:     V.
 1116: 
 1117: grab_bag_16a(V) ->
 1118:     try
 1119:         catch 22,
 1120:     receive
 1121:     after bad ->
 1122:             not_reached
 1123:     end
 1124:     catch
 1125:         _:V ->
 1126:             error
 1127:     end.
 1128: 
 1129: grab_bag_16b(V) ->
 1130:     try
 1131:         receive
 1132:         after get() ->
 1133:                 ok
 1134:         end
 1135:     catch
 1136:         V:Reason ->
 1137:             Reason
 1138:     end.
 1139: 
 1140: grab_bag_17() ->
 1141:     try "xwCl" of
 1142:         V when V ->
 1143:             <<[] || V>>;
 1144:         [_|_] ->
 1145:             %% Constant propagation in beam_ssa_codegen:prefer_xregs/2
 1146:             %% would produce get_hd and get_tl instructions with literal
 1147:             %% operands.
 1148:             fact
 1149:     catch
 1150:         _:_ ->
 1151:             []
 1152:     end.
 1153: 
 1154: grab_bag_18() ->
 1155:     try 0 of
 1156:         _V0 ->
 1157:             bnot false
 1158:     after
 1159:         try [] of
 1160:             wrong ->
 1161:                 ok
 1162:         catch
 1163:             _:_ when false ->
 1164:                 error
 1165:         end
 1166:     end.
 1167: 
 1168: grab_bag_19() ->
 1169:     ([<<bad/utf8>>] =
 1170:          %% beam_ssa_pre_codegen would produce single-valued phi
 1171:          %% nodes, which in turn would cause the constant propagation
 1172:          %% in beam_ssa_codegen:prefer_xregs/2 to produce get_hd and
 1173:          %% get_tl instructions with literal operands.
 1174:          try
 1175:              [whatever]
 1176:          catch
 1177:              _:_ when false ->
 1178:                  ok
 1179:          end) ! (some_atom ++ <<>>).
 1180: 
 1181: grab_bag_20() ->
 1182:     %% Similarly to grab_bag_19, beam_ssa_pre_codegen would produce
 1183:     %% single-valued phi nodes. The fix for grab_bag_19 would not
 1184:     %% suffice because several phi nodes were involved.
 1185:     {[_ | _] =
 1186:          receive
 1187:              list ->
 1188:                  "list";
 1189:              1 when day ->
 1190:                  []
 1191:          after
 1192:              0 ->
 1193:                  if
 1194:                      false ->
 1195:                          error
 1196:                  end
 1197:          end,
 1198:      try
 1199:          ok
 1200:      catch
 1201:          error:_ ->
 1202:              error
 1203:      end}.
 1204: 
 1205: %% With the `no_copt` and `no_ssa_opt` options, an internal
 1206: %% consistency error would be reported:
 1207: %%
 1208: %% Internal consistency check failed - please report this bug.
 1209: %% Instruction: {test_heap,2,2}
 1210: %% Error:       {{x,0},not_live}:
 1211: grab_bag_21(A) ->
 1212:     _ = id(0),
 1213:     grab_bag_21(ok, A div 10, node(), [-1]).
 1214: 
 1215: grab_bag_21(_, D, _, _) ->
 1216:     D.
 1217: 
 1218: %% GH-7128: With optimizations disabled, the code would fail to
 1219: %% load with the following message:
 1220: %%
 1221: %%    beam/beam_load.c(367): Error loading function
 1222: %%      beam_ssa_no_opt_SUITE:grab_bag_22/0: op get_list: Sdd:
 1223: %%         bad tag 2 for destination
 1224: grab_bag_22() ->
 1225:     maybe
 1226:         [_ | _] ?= ((true xor true) andalso foo),
 1227:         bar ?= id(42)
 1228:     end.
 1229: 
 1230: redundant_br(_Config) ->
 1231:     {false,{x,y,z}} = redundant_br_1(id({x,y,z})),
 1232:     {true,[[a,b,c]]} = redundant_br_1(id([[[a,b,c]]])),
 1233:     ok.
 1234: 
 1235: redundant_br_1(Specs0) ->
 1236:     {Join,Specs} =
 1237:         if
 1238:             is_list(hd(hd(Specs0))) -> {true,hd(Specs0)};
 1239:             true -> {false,Specs0}
 1240:         end,
 1241:     id({Join,Specs}).
 1242: 
 1243: -record(coverage, {name}).
 1244: 
 1245: coverage(_Config) ->
 1246: 
 1247:     %% Cover beam_ssa_codegen:force_reg/2
 1248:     no_match = case true of
 1249:                    <<_:42>> -> true;
 1250:                    _ -> no_match
 1251:               end,
 1252: 
 1253:     no_match = case [] of
 1254:                    <<$f:1.7>> -> ok;
 1255:                    _ -> no_match
 1256:                end,
 1257:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,$T},_}} = (catch coverage_1()),
 1258: 
 1259:     error = coverage_2(),
 1260:     ok = coverage_3(),
 1261:     #coverage{name=whatever} = coverage_4(),
 1262:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,ok},_}} = catch coverage_5(),
 1263: 
 1264:     ok.
 1265: 
 1266: coverage_1() ->
 1267:     <<area/signed-bitstring>> = $T.
 1268: 
 1269: coverage_2() when << []:<<0/native>> >> -> ok;
 1270: coverage_2() -> error.
 1271: 
 1272: coverage_3() ->
 1273:     %% Cover a line in beam_ssa_pre_codegen:need_frame_1/2.
 1274:     get(),
 1275:     ok.
 1276: 
 1277: coverage_4() ->
 1278:     try
 1279:         << <<42>> || false >>,
 1280:         #coverage{}
 1281:     catch
 1282:         _:_ ->
 1283:             error
 1284:     end#coverage{name = whatever}.
 1285: 
 1286: coverage_5() ->
 1287:     try
 1288:         << <<42>> || false >>,
 1289:         ok
 1290:     catch
 1291:         _:_ ->
 1292:             error
 1293:     end#coverage{name = whatever}.
 1294: 
 1295: %% Test beam_ssa:normalize/1, especially that argument types are
 1296: %% correctly updated when arguments are swapped.
 1297: normalize(_Config) ->
 1298:     normalize_commutative({bif,'band'}),
 1299:     normalize_commutative({bif,'+'}),
 1300: 
 1301:     normalize_noncommutative({bif,'div'}),
 1302: 
 1303:     ok.
 1304: 
 1305: -record(b_var, {name}).
 1306: -record(b_literal, {val}).
 1307: 
 1308: normalize_commutative(Op) ->
 1309:     A = #b_var{name=a},
 1310:     B = #b_var{name=b},
 1311:     Lit = #b_literal{val=42},
 1312: 
 1313:     normalize_same(Op, [A,B]),
 1314:     normalize_same(Op, [A,Lit]),
 1315: 
 1316:     normalize_swapped(Op, [Lit,A]),
 1317: 
 1318:     ok.
 1319: 
 1320: normalize_noncommutative(Op) ->
 1321:     A = #b_var{name=a},
 1322:     B = #b_var{name=b},
 1323:     Lit = #b_literal{val=42},
 1324: 
 1325:     normalize_same(Op, [A,B]),
 1326:     normalize_same(Op, [A,Lit]),
 1327: 
 1328:     ArgTypes0 = [{1,beam_types:make_integer(0, 1023)}],
 1329:     I1 = make_bset(ArgTypes0, Op, [Lit,A]),
 1330:     I1 = beam_ssa:normalize(I1),
 1331: 
 1332:     ok.
 1333: 
 1334: normalize_same(Op, Args) ->
 1335:     I0 = make_bset(#{}, Op, Args),
 1336:     I0 = beam_ssa:normalize(I0),
 1337: 
 1338:     ArgTypes0 = [{0,beam_types:make_integer(0, 1023)}],
 1339:     I1 = make_bset(ArgTypes0, Op, Args),
 1340:     I1 = beam_ssa:normalize(I1),
 1341: 
 1342:     case Args of
 1343:         [#b_var{},#b_var{}] ->
 1344:             ArgTypes1 = [{0,beam_types:make_integer(0, 1023)},
 1345:                          {1,beam_types:make_integer(42)}],
 1346:             I2 = make_bset(ArgTypes1, Op, Args),
 1347:             I2 = beam_ssa:normalize(I2);
 1348:         [_,_] ->
 1349:             ok
 1350:     end,
 1351: 
 1352:     ok.
 1353: 
 1354: normalize_swapped(Op, [#b_literal{}=Lit,#b_var{}=Var]=Args) ->
 1355:     EmptyAnno = #{},
 1356:     I0 = make_bset(EmptyAnno, Op, Args),
 1357:     {b_set,EmptyAnno,#b_var{name=1000},Op,[Var,Lit]} = beam_ssa:normalize(I0),
 1358: 
 1359:     EmptyTypes = #{arg_types => #{}},
 1360:     I1 = make_bset(EmptyTypes, Op, Args),
 1361:     {b_set,EmptyTypes,#b_var{name=1000},Op,[Var,Lit]} = beam_ssa:normalize(I1),
 1362: 
 1363:     IntRange = beam_types:make_integer(0, 1023),
 1364:     ArgTypes0 = [{1,IntRange}],
 1365:     I2 = make_bset(ArgTypes0, Op, Args),
 1366:     {[{0,IntRange}],Op,[Var,Lit]} = unpack_bset(beam_ssa:normalize(I2)),
 1367: 
 1368:     LitType = beam_types:make_type_from_value(Lit),
 1369: 
 1370:     ArgTypes1 = [{0,LitType}],
 1371:     I3 = make_bset(ArgTypes1, Op, Args),
 1372:     {[],Op,[Var,Lit]} = unpack_bset(beam_ssa:normalize(I3)),
 1373: 
 1374:     ArgTypes2 = [{0,LitType},{1,IntRange}],
 1375:     I4 = make_bset(ArgTypes1, Op, Args),
 1376:     {[],Op,[Var,Lit]} = unpack_bset(beam_ssa:normalize(I4)),
 1377: 
 1378:     ok.
 1379: 
 1380: make_bset(ArgTypes, Op, Args) when is_list(ArgTypes) ->
 1381:     Anno = #{arg_types => maps:from_list(ArgTypes)},
 1382:     {b_set,Anno,#b_var{name=1000},Op,Args};
 1383: make_bset(Anno, Op, Args) when is_map(Anno) ->
 1384:     {b_set,Anno,#b_var{name=1000},Op,Args}.
 1385: 
 1386: unpack_bset({b_set,Anno,{b_var,1000},Op,Args}) ->
 1387:     ArgTypes = maps:get(arg_types, Anno, #{}),
 1388:     {lists:sort(maps:to_list(ArgTypes)),Op,Args}.
 1389: 
 1390: trycatch(_Config) ->
 1391:     8 = trycatch_1(),
 1392: 
 1393:     ok = trycatch_2(id(ok)),
 1394:     ok = trycatch_2(id(z)),
 1395: 
 1396:     false = trycatch_3(id(42)),
 1397: 
 1398:     ok.
 1399: 
 1400: trycatch_1() ->
 1401:     try B = (A = bit_size(iolist_to_binary("a"))) rem 1 of
 1402:         _ ->
 1403:             A;
 1404:         _ ->
 1405:             B
 1406:     after
 1407:         ok
 1408:     end.
 1409: 
 1410: trycatch_2(A) ->
 1411:     try not (B = (ok >= A)) of
 1412:         B ->
 1413:             iolist_size(maybe
 1414:                             [] ?= B,
 1415:                             <<>> ?= list_to_binary(ok)
 1416:                         end);
 1417:         _ ->
 1418:             ok
 1419:     after
 1420:         ok
 1421:     end.
 1422: 
 1423: trycatch_3(A) ->
 1424:     try erlang:bump_reductions(A) of
 1425:         B ->
 1426:             try not (C = (B andalso is_number(ok))) of
 1427:                 C ->
 1428:                     ok andalso ok;
 1429:                 _ ->
 1430:                     C
 1431:             catch
 1432:                 _ ->
 1433:                     ok
 1434:             end
 1435:     after
 1436:         ok
 1437:     end.
 1438: 
 1439: %% GH-6599. beam_validator would not realize that the code was safe.
 1440: gh_6599(_Config) ->
 1441:     ok = gh_6599_1(id(42), id(42)),
 1442:     #{ok := ok} = gh_6599_1(id(#{ok => 0}), id(#{ok => 0})),
 1443: 
 1444:     {'EXIT',{{try_clause,#{ok:=ok}},_}} =
 1445:         catch gh_6599_2(id(whatever), id(#{0 => whatever})),
 1446: 
 1447:     ok = gh_6599_3(id(true), id(true)),
 1448:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = catch gh_6599_3(id(false), id(false)),
 1449:     0.0 = gh_6599_3(id(0.0), id(0.0)),
 1450: 
 1451:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,true},_}} = catch gh_6599_4(id(false)),
 1452: 
 1453:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,ok},_}} = catch gh_6599_5(id([a]), id(#{0 => [a]}), id([a])),
 1454: 
 1455:     #{ok := ok} = gh_6599_6(id(#{}), id(#{})),
 1456:     {'EXIT',{{badmap,a},_}} = catch gh_6599_6(id(a), id(a)),
 1457: 
 1458:     {'EXIT',{{badarg,ok},_}} = catch gh_6599_7(id([a]), id([a])),
 1459: 
 1460:     ok.
 1461: 
 1462: gh_6599_1(X, X) when is_integer(X) ->
 1463:     ok;
 1464: gh_6599_1(Y, Y = #{}) ->
 1465:     Y#{ok := ok}.
 1466: 
 1467: gh_6599_2(X, #{0 := X, 0 := Y}) ->
 1468:     try #{ok => ok} of
 1469:         Y ->
 1470:             bnot (Y = X)
 1471:     after
 1472:         ok
 1473:     end.
 1474: 
 1475: gh_6599_3(X, X) when X ->
 1476:     ok;
 1477: gh_6599_3(X, X = 0.0) ->
 1478:     X + X.
 1479: 
 1480: gh_6599_4(X) ->
 1481:     Y =
 1482:         try
 1483:             false = X
 1484:         catch
 1485:             _ ->
 1486:                 ok
 1487:         end /= ok,
 1488:     X = Y,
 1489:     false = Y,
 1490:     0 = ok.
 1491: 
 1492: %% Crashes in beam_ssa_type because a type assertion fails.
 1493: gh_6599_5(X, #{0 := X, 0 := Y}, Y=[_ | _]) ->
 1494:     try
 1495:         Y = ok
 1496:     catch
 1497:         _ ->
 1498:             [_ | []] = Y = X
 1499:     end.
 1500: 
 1501: gh_6599_6(A, B = A) ->
 1502:     A#{},
 1503:     case A of B -> B end#{ok => ok}.
 1504: 
 1505: gh_6599_7(X, Y) ->
 1506:     try Y of
 1507:         X ->
 1508:             (id(
 1509:                 try ([_ | _] = Y) of
 1510:                     X ->
 1511:                         ok
 1512:                 after
 1513:                     ok
 1514:                 end
 1515:             ) orelse X) bsl 0
 1516:     after
 1517:         ok
 1518:     end.
 1519: 
 1520: 
 1521: %% The identity function.
 1522: id(I) -> I.
